posts.name: Miles.D
posts.cooked: This is my first year being a programmer and this new radio is kicking my butt. I have gotten lost trying to config it for the past 2 days and now I am throwing in the towel. how the frick do you config the dam thing.

posts.name: Gavin Matthews
posts.cooked: Hi!  I assume you’ve been trying to work through Programming Your Radio .  It would be much easier to help you if you could explain what steps you have taken and point out where your experience differed from what you expected.

link_counts.title: Programming Your Radio | FIRST FRC Radio

posts.name: Javier Molina Jr
posts.cooked: Have you tried this source from FRC : Programming your Radio — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation I recommend using a Windows 10/11 to do this process

link_counts.title: Programming your Radio — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Ryan Blue
posts.cooked: Currently that page describes the process for the old OpenMesh radios, not the new VH-109 radios that will be used in 2025.

posts.name: Fletcher

link_counts.title: Programming Your Radio | FIRST FRC Radio

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between.

posts.custom_user_title: FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between.

posts.cooked: Something that I had to do when configuring my radio was to disable the laptops WIFI adapter in the windows control panel (Control Panel > Network and Internet > Network and Sharing Center > Change Adapter Settings > Disable WIFI). Then, connecting to it via ethernet allowed me to connect to the radio’s config page.

posts.name: Miles.D
posts.cooked: Thank all of you for the help but sadly it is a problem with our laptop our ethernet port died so we will have to get a new laptop.
